page.title: 10Farming
page.content: Mark's Tey Apple Farm is off Titchfield Road near the Old Church. The present owner is an ex-Naval Commander.The Apple Farm was started before the Second World War. The Apple Farm consists of 8 acres with apple trees and 2 acres for the house and gardens. The apples grown are mainly eating apples with some cooking varieties. They are graded and then sold direct to the public from their own shop. Trade has fallen during the years as housing has encroached and residents have complained about the spraying of the trees.Other housing has hidden the farm from the road so advertising is more expensive. The owner has applied for planning permission for the land but at the moment plans have been turned down. Coxes Orange Pippin are the main crop.
